1. This is the energy content of both primary and secondary fuel supplied to final users. Thus it is net of the fuel
industry's own use and conversion, transmission and distribution losses. The energy necessary to evaporate the
water present in the fuel or formed during the combustion process is also excluded. The non-energy use of fuels is
column15: Digest of United Kingdom Energy Statistics;

column1: 2. There are revisions to some of the earlier data, for details see Digest of UK Energy Statistics 2012 (DUKES)
3. The 'road transport - petroleum' and 'transport total' energy consumption figures differ slightly from those in ENV0101
since they include a small amount of petroleum consumption from off-road machinery and equipment.
4. These figures include international and military aviation/shipping and thus marine bunkers.
